words.definition: Access is the right to enter or use something.
words.example: The manager was the only person with access to the password.

words.definition: Conduct is the way that someone acts.
words.example: She was punished for her bad conduct.

words.definition: When an event or action is constant, it happens a lot or all the time.
words.example: The television at home is in constant use.

words.definition: A crack is a narrow space between the parts of something broken.
words.example: The old window was covered with cracks.

words.definition: A device is an object or machine that has a special purpose.
words.example: A smartphone is a very useful device.

words.definition: To enclose something means to put it inside something else.
words.example: He enclosed a photo with the letter.

words.definition: To grip something means to hold it very tightly.
words.example: He gripped the steering wheel firmly.

words.definition: A halt is a stop for a short period of time.
words.example: The train came to a halt at the station.

words.definition: If something is impending, it is going to happen soon.
words.example: They were worried about the impending storm.

words.definition: Influence is the power to have an effect on someone or something.
words.example: His parents had a great influence on his life.

words.definition: A law is a rule made by the government.
words.example: You must follow the law.

words.definition: A mode is a particular way of doing something.
words.example: The computer has several different modes of operation.

words.definition: To perspire means to sweat.
words.example: He began to perspire from the heat.

words.definition: To replace something means to put something new in its place.
words.example: We need to replace the old batteries.

words.definition: To snap means to break something suddenly with a sharp noise.
words.example: The dry branch snapped under his feet.

words.definition: If someone is sly, they are clever and deceptive.
words.example: The sly fox stole the chicken.

words.definition: To tend to do something means to usually do it.
words.example: I tend to wake up early on weekends.

words.definition: If something is valid, it is acceptable or correct.
words.example: Your passport is no longer valid.

words.definition: A version is a particular form of something.
words.example: I have the latest version of this software.

words.definition: You use whatsoever to emphasize a negative statement.
words.example: He had no reason whatsoever to be angry.
